author: Theo Francis
title: The New Corporate Diet: Fatter Profits, Skinnier Tax Bills
text:
The largest U.S. companies found a new formula for success in the first quarter: Larger pretax profits and smaller tax bills.
More than half of the combined net income reported by 200 large public companies in the first quarter stemmed from a decline in the companiesâ€™ effective tax rates, a Wall Street Journal analysis of quarterly financial data from Calcbench found.
At... RELATED VIDEO Want a 20% Business Deduction? Here Are the Obstacles Congress just created a new tax break for millions of pass-through businesses. But every business owner doesn't automatically qualify. WSJ's Richard Rubin overcomes the obstacles to claim the 20% pass through business deduction - on an actual obstacle course.
